content: Presidential election in Singapore Indirect presidential elections were held in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) on 23 October 1981, after the death of the incumbent president [Benjamin Sheares](/wiki/Benjamin_Sheares). During the election, 58 members of Parliament were present while 14 members were absent. [Devan Nair](/wiki/Devan_Nair) was elected by the [Parliament of Singapore](/wiki/Parliament_of_Singapore). Nair was sworn in as the third president on 24 October 1981. ## Results CandidatePartyVotes%[Devan Nair](/wiki/Devan_Nair)Independent58100.00Total58100.00Total votes58â€“Registered voters/turnout7280.56 This Asian election-related article is a stub. title: 1981 Singaporean presidential election
